results.content:
Sorry to ask for refund. The amount i paid is so small and is not important, i ask for refund because of i lost too much time (which is invaluable) for nothing.

I gave up in this lesson:

https://www.udemy.com/course/wordpress-development-create-wordpress-themes-and-plugins/learn/lecture/4479364

1) Instructor switches between windows and copies/pastes content between different files in light speed. I have to watch 5-10 times even in slowest speed.

2) Around 10. minute, instructor says "I will copy this part form index.php." and opens index.php but in less than a quarter second, it opens another file (content-excerpt.php) and copies from this file.

You are like cats watching the ball in a ping pong game.

Most of your time is wasted to understand where and how he did that. Due this exhausting effort, you are unable to concentrate and understand lesson's content.

results.content: I'm still completing this course, but have arrived at the stage where I am so infuriated by my experience of trying to follow what is happening that I felt compelled comment. It all started out so well... But at some point (can't exactly remember where) I got the distinct impression that he became pressed for time, and began delivering the content in a style betraying a simply breath-taking arrogance.  He even manages to thwart your attempts to use the rewind button by providing general commentary of his code, while simultaneously fast-forwarding code and switching to a different file BEFORE you can see what he has written in the previous one. I challenge you to take a look at the later lectures and see for yourself! I am in no doubt that the instructor knows his stuff. However, I am also in no doubt that he knows not how to take his passengers along with him on his journey.

results.content: This course is perfect for anyone who wants to get started with WordPress development. It's straight to the point and goes into a lot of details that would have taken me hours if not days to learn on my own. The pace of the lectures are a little bit fast but for me it was perfect and I finished the course in a week. I have been doing back-end PHP programming for over 10 years and only recently started getting into WordPress. I now feel confident to take on any WordPress based project.

results.content:
Until now the best course in this subject I have seen. The instructor is very complete in the information he gives, very clear in his explanations and where in most other courses on theme design I often encountered violations to 'WordPress best practices' as defined in the WordPress Codex by the instructor of that course, the instructor of this one doesn't only teach best practices, but even explains why they are 'best practices'. 

If you want to learn (more) about theme development this course is highly recommended. 

Small notice for improvement, the course is on a quite monotonous tone. When I'm after a day of work and try to learn, it sometimes really makes me sleepy. For the next courses try a bit more engaging way of speaking.

results.content:
So far so great, theme development part of the tutorial is excellent. So long as you are quick on the pause button (he goes quite fast), have knowledge of CSS/HTML/JS/PHP and basic knowledge of wordpress itself.. this is a fantastic course.

Well explained, easy to follow and a great insight into best practice theme development in wordpress. I'd highly recommend this course so far... haven't gotten to the plugin development yet.

I think some wp functions etc have changed slightly since the videos were created- so you need to check the current codex and not just copy and paste from the video at times, that aside it's a very clear tutorial.

results.content: This is a phenomenal course if you're into WordPress development. I am not fully through but have browsed through most of the sections. Please do not waste your money.

Once again- terrible teacher and a terrible course. Please do not buy.

results.content:
I would have given the instructor 5 out of 5 stars on content alone. The information in this course would take you from beginner to advanced as advertised.

The instructor forgets that he is supposed to be instructing, and he goes extremely fast between screens. I am not a beginner and none of this material was over my head, and it was quite valuable to me. However, I've spent way too much time backing the video up trying to catch the information he was zipping through. I'm not implying that the instructor was going too fast for me, he just needed to add a couple of seconds to each screen change so you can see what he is doing. Not even enough time to see what template or file he is on, or what section of the file.

At my level, I should be able to go through this course in much less time, and I have been left extremely frustrated.

I believe the instructor has cheated himself out of excellent reviews by not producing a quality product that you can follow.

If you want the information bad enough, and you have loads of patience, go for it. I'm not recommending this course for beginners, you'll be lost.

results.content:
The author knows his stuff and has a good selection of topics and teaches a lot of detail. The downside is that keeping up with the lightning fast selection and typing is ridiculously hard. Even with pause and repeat of the video, it's very easy to end up with pages with syntax errors due to mismatched parentheses or HTML tags.

1. Suggest using theme with less silly markup (too many DIVs, where's the semantic HTML tags).
2. Attach files with each lesson that are what students should have at the end of each lesson. It solves the frustration of keeping up with the fast text changes onscreen.

results.content: I wouldn't be surprised if this is the most comprehensive WordPress course on the net. The instructor is thorough and clear. Very easy to understand and maintains a consistent easy to follow along with pace for the entire course, never rushing a lesson. I have been developing WordPress sites for years using Genesis and although I can build a site quickly using Genesis, I couldn't class myself as WordPress developer as I wasn't using a lot of the native APIs and functions. After taking this course I have all the knowledge I now need to build a theme without using Genesis. There was a log of 'ahah!' moments whilst taking this course, it's great and highly recommended!

results.content:
Someone buy this man a pop filter! The audio quality is “decent”, but there’s a very loud mic pop every few seconds, which makes it difficult to get through the course without a certain amount of anxiety from having your speakers constantly exploding. 

The Gutenberg section is very good, and it’s the most thoughtfully executed section. The rest of the course covers a comprehensive variety of WP’s APIs, but much of it feels rushed. If you’re a proficient PHP/JS developer with a passing familiarity of WordPress, I might recommend only watching instead of coding-along, since the instructor moves very quickly and is sometimes frustrating to follow. The plugin you spend most of the course building is a good real-world example, but in an age of OOP and MVC, I feel like the project structure is as outdated/convoluted as the WP core itself. 

All in all, this is an okay overview of WP APIs for developers to take a look at before they dive into the docs. Unfortunately, the constant mic pops make the course almost unbearable to get through, and I feel like the instructor’s delivery needs some work.

If you’re a proficient PHP/JS developer with a passing familiarity of WordPress, I might recommend only watching instead of coding-along, since the instructor moves very quickly and is sometimes frustrating to follow. results.content:
Disclaimer: I have not completed the course, but have gotten through a good number of lessons to know that I won't complete the course.  Two things bother me, and keep me from maintaining interest in continuing.

Firstly, the instructor has a bad delivery in terms of his rhythmic speech.  He is clear and understandable, but the delivery of his words are this repetitive rhythm that sounds like unnatural delivery of speech, especially for instruction/education of any kind.  It's distracting and has a tendency to lull me to disinterest because it doesn't sound engaging at all.

Secondly, he moves way too fast when doing cut/copy/paste actions ... I'm not at all one to normally complain about this because I'll generally pause/stop/rewind/slow the video, but I reached my limit on having to literally slow the video to 0.5 just to see a blur of cutting/pasting between files because he impatiently needs to just get it done at light speed.  When attempting to learn how to move chunks of code from one file to another as students, this is really not acceptable, as we don't know the files like the instructor knows the files, so that, for me, is not thoughtful for the sake of the student's learning experience.

Finally, I think the instructor knows his stuff, and clearly understands how to work with WordPress.  The course is very comprehensive and he moves at a good pace.  There's a great deal of info to cover, and aside from those two things, this could be a really great course.  Unfortunately, for my taste, those two things prevent me from wanting to continue any further, as they are extremely distracting to the point of making me disinterested.

Bottom line is WordPress is so nuanced that you'll never remember every single little thing unless you develop with it daily, so having this course in your back pocket for future reference will be extremely useful.

results.content: This course is great. The teacher is really an expert in WordPress. I have been working for more than 10 years with WordPress, but now I feel that I'm really starting to understand WordPress and I'm only halfway through the course. In addition, if you have a question you will get an answer soon.

results.content:
This is an amazing course! It goes to such depth and teaches so much: how to develop themes, plugins, how to extend the gutenberg editor. This is definitely not a beginner course. All the videos are packed with so much information! It takes me 30 minutes to an hour to do a 10 to 15 minute video just to follow the steps and to understand all the steps. 

If you know wordpress and php, have some experience with web development projects and want to learn how to create your own plugins and themes, I highly recommend it. This course is perfect for me.
